commit_message:
Use upper constraints for all jobs in tox.ini

Openstack infra now supports upper constraints for
all jobs. This patch removes install_command for
upper constraints from all post jobs.

Change-Id: I37fa82d49bcdea0409ec526063c077c32dbf094f
Closes-Bug: #1614117

commit_message:
Log get_schema_name failure in ovsdb connection

The method get_schema_name in neutron.agent.ovsdb.connection may fail,
since e.g. it relies on the connection to OVSDB.

This change adds a log in case of such a failure.

Change-Id: I3e91178b69f74c753738003db38cc79ee2095f47
Related-Bug: 1612403

commit_message:
Modify the SQL's string from double quote to single quote.

Using double quotes for strings does not conform to the ANSI standard.
While MySQL accepts it, PostgreSQL raises an error.

This patch fixes crash when used with PostgreSQL.

Closes-Bug: #1606534
Change-Id: Id979043b1573bf2ea473e772c7ea7417c733d753

Accordingly to REST API best practices we have the following urls

- /objects - for collection objects operations and new object creation,

commit_message:
API urls changed

Accordingly to REST API best practices we have the following urls
schema:

- /objects - for collection objects operations and new object creation,
- /objects/<id> - for specific object operations.

Change-Id: Ifebc613ab5dac1674a6de488dce5757da2362cd4

subject: Allow identity plugins to discover relative version urls
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-18 00:04:17.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneauth1/identity/base.py', 'keystoneauth1/tests/unit/identity/test_identity_common.py'], 'message': 'Allow identity plugins to discover relative version urls

When using a reverse proxy or TLS terminator it can be really hard to
correctly specify a URL in version discovery that is correct for all
situations.

Make it so that a relative URL in a discovery document is joined to the
queried URL to always return a fully qualified URL to the identity
plugins.

Change-Id: Ia08538ccf00c9063dc0d284c5ece9a969c15500a
Closes-Bug: #1614304
'}]
commit_message:
Allow identity plugins to discover relative version urls

When using a reverse proxy or TLS terminator it can be really hard to
correctly specify a URL in version discovery that is correct for all
situations.

Make it so that a relative URL in a discovery document is joined to the
queried URL to always return a fully qualified URL to the identity
plugins.

Change-Id: Ia08538ccf00c9063dc0d284c5ece9a969c15500a
Closes-Bug: #1614304

commit_message:
Change logic for checking failed tests in assert_ostf_run().

If in list actual_failed names we have something else that
 we are ordered in failed_test_name test must be failed.
But if in list actual_failed_names we haven't all tests
 that we are ordered in failed_test_name test must be passed.

Closes bug: 1615517

Change-Id: Ibaafe43039e96d6a39b7c405ac6a0ef55d373c8c

[{'number': 13, 'created': '2016-08-20 16:34:23.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/openstack/heat/value.py', 'heat/engine/properties.py', 'heat/engine/constraints.py', 'heat/tests/openstack/heat/test_value.py'], 'message': 'Add OS::Heat::Value resource

The OS::Heat::Value resource provides a "value" attribute that may be
calculated through references to other parameters or resources. Other
resources may then reference this value.

The primary motivation is to avoid having to create nested templates
that only exist to execute these kinds of data transformations.

This resource's "type" property is optional but recommended.

Change-Id: I72fdab8261336644a9545668fac6f4e49a785e36
'}]
commit_message:
Add OS::Heat::Value resource

The OS::Heat::Value resource provides a "value" attribute that may be
calculated through references to other parameters or resources. Other
resources may then reference this value.

The primary motivation is to avoid having to create nested templates
that only exist to execute these kinds of data transformations.

This resource's "type" property is optional but recommended.

Change-Id: I72fdab8261336644a9545668fac6f4e49a785e36

The fix to ns_IPaddr2 is added in order to make sure that we
are sending gratuitous ARP on failover. Also ocf_run is used

commit_message:
Change arp_send to arping

The fix to ns_IPaddr2 is added in order to make sure that we
are sending gratuitous ARP on failover. Also ocf_run is used
as it is necessary on CentOS platform for running ARPPING.

Closes-Bug: #1463382

Change-Id: I4104bc79a3ad0fabe9a7736a6b9c820aa0b09f37

subject: Working around some corner cases
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-03-20 15:01:49.000000000', 'files': ['fuelweb_test/tests/test_ha.py', 'fuelweb_test/models/fuel_web_client.py', 'fuelweb_test/tests/tests_strength/test_restart.py', 'fuelweb_test/tests/test_ceph.py', 'fuelweb_test/tests/tests_strength/test_neutron.py'], 'message': "Working around some corner cases

The patch adds more checks to tests involved in reverting live
snapshots. This is needed because after reverting such a snapshot there
is a posibillity to have a broken RabbitMQ-cluster or Ceph installation.
The root cause of these problems is a time shift introduced by `ntpdate`
calls in revert_snapshot(). Increased the timeout in
assert_ha_services_ready().
Also added a function to restart Ceph services on all OSD-nodes
unconditionally. It only works for CentOS, as Ubuntu's Ceph has an
ability to restart its OSDs.

Change-Id: Ibc86080e46e079408b8302ad6d8b4d2664cdd38a
Closes-bug: #1558557
Closes-bug: #1557535
Signed-off-by: Denis V. Meltsaykin <dmeltsaykin@mirantis.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Working around some corner cases

The patch adds more checks to tests involved in reverting live
snapshots. This is needed because after reverting such a snapshot there
is a posibillity to have a broken RabbitMQ-cluster or Ceph installation.
The root cause of these problems is a time shift introduced by `ntpdate`
calls in revert_snapshot(). Increased the timeout in
assert_ha_services_ready().
Also added a function to restart Ceph services on all OSD-nodes
unconditionally. It only works for CentOS, as Ubuntu's Ceph has an
ability to restart its OSDs.

Change-Id: Ibc86080e46e079408b8302ad6d8b4d2664cdd38a
Closes-bug: #1558557
Closes-bug: #1557535
Signed-off-by: Denis V. Meltsaykin <dmeltsaykin@mirantis.com>

subject: Working around some corner cases
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-21 17:03:31.000000000', 'files': ['fuelweb_test/tests/test_neutron_tun.py', 'fuelweb_test/models/fuel_web_client.py', 'fuelweb_test/tests/tests_strength/test_restart.py', 'fuelweb_test/tests/test_ceph.py', 'fuelweb_test/helpers/utils.py', 'fuelweb_test/tests/tests_strength/test_neutron.py'], 'message': 'Working around some corner cases

The patch adds more checks to tests involved in reverting live
snapshots. This is needed because after reverting such a snapshot there
is a posibillity to have a broken RabbitMQ-cluster or Ceph installation.
The root cause of these problems is a time shift introduced by `ntpdate`
calls in revert_snapshot(). Increased the timeout in
assert_ha_services_ready().
Also added the repeat_until() function to make sure that HA services
are really UP, as there is a chance that pacemaker will restart the
RabbitMQ cluster after successful check due to bigger timeouts and new
logic.

Closes-bug: #1558557
Closes-bug: #1557535

Signed-off-by: Denis V. Meltsaykin <dmeltsaykin@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: Ibc86080e46e079408b8302ad6d8b4d2664cdd38a
'}]
commit_message:
Working around some corner cases

The patch adds more checks to tests involved in reverting live
snapshots. This is needed because after reverting such a snapshot there
is a posibillity to have a broken RabbitMQ-cluster or Ceph installation.
The root cause of these problems is a time shift introduced by `ntpdate`
calls in revert_snapshot(). Increased the timeout in
assert_ha_services_ready().
Also added the repeat_until() function to make sure that HA services
are really UP, as there is a chance that pacemaker will restart the
RabbitMQ cluster after successful check due to bigger timeouts and new
logic.

Closes-bug: #1558557
Closes-bug: #1557535

Signed-off-by: Denis V. Meltsaykin <dmeltsaykin@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: Ibc86080e46e079408b8302ad6d8b4d2664cdd38a

subject: Set a long package cache timeout for OpenStack-CI
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-20 23:19:59.000000000', 'files': ['tests/roles/bootstrap-host/tasks/prepare_aio_config.yml', 'tests/roles/bootstrap-host/templates/user_variables.aio.yml.j2'], 'message': 'Set a long package cache timeout for OpenStack-CI

OpenStack-CI implements a mechanism for rolling forward apt/deb
package sources in a way that generally does not result in cache
expiry in a short space of time.

The default in all OSA roles is currently 5 minutes, resulting
in several cache refreshes during CI execution. These refreshes
are a waste of time.

The OpenStack-CI mirror updates happen 120 minutes. This patch
opts to set the timeout to 60 mins.

Change-Id: If3c8dabafae2ecbe337197b9b7aa56edf295b5cb
'}]
commit_message:
Set a long package cache timeout for OpenStack-CI

OpenStack-CI implements a mechanism for rolling forward apt/deb
package sources in a way that generally does not result in cache
expiry in a short space of time.

The default in all OSA roles is currently 5 minutes, resulting
in several cache refreshes during CI execution. These refreshes
are a waste of time.

The OpenStack-CI mirror updates happen 120 minutes. This patch
opts to set the timeout to 60 mins.

Change-Id: If3c8dabafae2ecbe337197b9b7aa56edf295b5cb

commit_message:
Correct env status in the new session

In the dashboard it is possible to make some changes in the current
session, then close this session and open another one. The result
of this was that changes were not saved but env's status was
changed.
With this patch status of environment is 'Ready to deploy' only
in case when current services list is not equal to the list of
last deployed services.
UI tests to check this behaviour are added.

Change-Id: I925e1f1caf0795960b56cc88b887430dc4871742
Closes-bug: #1606891

subject: Do not abort if README file not found
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-22 00:19:30.000000000', 'files': ['releasetools/release_notes.py'], 'message': "Do not abort if README file not found

Currently if README.{md,rst} is not found in the source repo announce.sh
raises a RuntimeError and aborts.  This means that the email template
isn't written.  This ultimately overall job failing as the email can't
be sent.

A recent example of this is at:
    http://logs.openstack.org/03/03c4534b0e1ba2a6c4ad0aaa471070fd53b2ae73/release/xstatic-bootstrap-scss-announce-release/288f27d/console.html#_2016-08-18_18_21_11_191756

The README file us used to get the bug and source urls.  The jinja
templates are setup to function correctly if these are empty strings.
So demote this situation to a warning and announce the release.

Change-Id: Ie492191a79b903a8079fa64ef11a71fbb4fb4903
"}]
commit_message:
Do not abort if README file not found

Currently if README.{md,rst} is not found in the source repo announce.sh
raises a RuntimeError and aborts.  This means that the email template
isn't written.  This ultimately overall job failing as the email can't
be sent.

A recent example of this is at:
    http://logs.openstack.org/03/03c4534b0e1ba2a6c4ad0aaa471070fd53b2ae73/release/xstatic-bootstrap-scss-announce-release/288f27d/console.html#_2016-08-18_18_21_11_191756

The README file us used to get the bug and source urls.  The jinja
templates are setup to function correctly if these are empty strings.
So demote this situation to a warning and announce the release.

Change-Id: Ie492191a79b903a8079fa64ef11a71fbb4fb4903

commit_message:
Add new test for fuelweb 'Deployment with 1 controller, Neutron Vlan and add, add/delete controllers'

        Scenario:
        1. Deploy cluster: 1 controller, Neutron Vlan, default storages
        2. Verify networks
        3. Run OSTF
        4. Add 2 controllers
        5. Re-deploy cluster
        6. Verify networks
        7. Run OSTF
        8. Add 2 controllers, 1 compute, 1 cinder node
        9. Re-deploy cluster
        10. Verify networks
        11. Run OSTF
        12. Delete primary controller
        13. Add another one controller
        14. Re-deploy cluster
        15. Verify networks
        16. Run OSTF

Related blueprint run-fuel-qa-on-baremetal

Change-Id: I16d34162546999f0133d84deeccc7b03e3b3ebbb

revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2016-08-20 13:09:04.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/run-upgrade.sh'], 'message': 'Print remaining tasks on failed upgrade correctly

run-upgrade.sh is designated to re-run from the place
where it failed. Previous behavior is to print entire tasks list
when failures happen. Printing tasks that successfully
completed is not desired. The new update will only show leftover
tasks for the users debugging.

Change-Id: I2e33c43d55696bb91cb40ff590e167546f5f6d18
Closes-Bug:1582272
'}]
commit_message:
Print remaining tasks on failed upgrade correctly

run-upgrade.sh is designated to re-run from the place
where it failed. Previous behavior is to print entire tasks list
when failures happen. Printing tasks that successfully
completed is not desired. The new update will only show leftover
tasks for the users debugging.

Change-Id: I2e33c43d55696bb91cb40ff590e167546f5f6d18
Closes-Bug:1582272

commit_message:
Fix ironic-conductor task dependencies

The ironic-conductor requires access to the ironic database which is
done in the ironic-db task. Previously we were just waiting for the
database task but we should require the ironic-db task which waits
for the database tasks to be completed and sets up the ironic database
user permissions.

Change-Id: I0a5d9007cf1fc286d4217faf977e54faf010eeb0
Closes-Bug: #1614473

commit_message:
Replace `template_ids` array with `definitions_index` dict

- `template_id` is not enough for content validation of `definition`
- Using dict instead of array will speed up the existence check

Related-Bug: #1614319

commit_message:
Add backwards compatibility for openstackclient

Im deploying manually TripleO (latest master)
and using endpoint list does not return any valid value.

Applying the current patch both options for 'list or show'
will be used if the first its not able to get the endpoint correctly.

Change-Id: I10b10a5017ba255d8df9547e928418cad9cf04ff

commit_message:
Fix ceilometer user groups on compute nodes

Now package [0] handles addition of ceilometer user to libvirt group, so
shouldn't handle this from Puppet.

[0] https://review.fuel-infra.org/gitweb?p=openstack-build/ceilometer-build.git;a=blob;f=trusty/debian/ceilometer-common.postinst.in;h=623271b3d33ef4809480c44ac76e3497a34a7e11;hb=refs/heads/master#l7

Change-Id: I092fbca27db2b0d5324231ded599ddd58b61350a
Closes-Bug: #1603446
(cherry picked from commit ed074039963e143b14b12faec3b2b170efbbdff8)

commit_message:

for both install-guide and install-guide-revised-draft would not work,
because the file/content now resides in targethosts-prepare.rst.

closes-bug: #1614727

subject: Delete python bytecode before every test run
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-23 07:03:30.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Delete python bytecode before every test run

Because python creates pyc|pyo files and __pycache__
directories during tox runs, certain changes in the tree,
like deletes of files, or switching branches, can create
spurious errors.

The target bytecodes for deletion are in normal directories,
but not in dot started directory.

Change-Id: Ie5e55b29a2f71c4c4f886de27f89f1b264b81529
'}]
commit_message:
Delete python bytecode before every test run

Because python creates pyc|pyo files and __pycache__
directories during tox runs, certain changes in the tree,
like deletes of files, or switching branches, can create
spurious errors.

The target bytecodes for deletion are in normal directories,
but not in dot started directory.

Change-Id: Ie5e55b29a2f71c4c4f886de27f89f1b264b81529

commit_message:
RootController: Use an index method instead of get

The index method authorizes HEAD request, which are handy for load
balancers.

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-08-10 23:28:41.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/services/volume/v2/json/admin/quotas_client.py', 'tempest/services/volume/v1/json/admin/quotas_client.py', 'tempest/services/volume/base/admin/base_quotas_client.py'], 'message': 'Remove base_quotas_client for the reability

The service clients for the volume service are different from the
other services and it is a little difficult to read and debug because
that consists of multiple layers for v1 and v2.
That could be useful for the code optimization, but actually the merit
seems small and unreadable.
This patch removes these layers from the volume clients.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: Ie6d37a72158e4d804727fa756018a37358c1fd59
'}]
commit_message:
Remove base_quotas_client for the reability

The service clients for the volume service are different from the
other services and it is a little difficult to read and debug because
that consists of multiple layers for v1 and v2.
That could be useful for the code optimization, but actually the merit
seems small and unreadable.
This patch removes these layers from the volume clients.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: Ie6d37a72158e4d804727fa756018a37358c1fd59

commit_message:
[DSH] Delete hardcoded image name

We have a debian 8 image for a long time, which
can be successfully used by docker standalone host
to run dockerized apps, but we still don't use it.
This commit deletes hardcode and adds image field to
ui with filter by type `linux.docker`.

Change-Id: Ie3d9d454cd98f651833b28690d33d55b404dc13d
(cherry picked from commit 906e6586c47d1496d8f6fe6a346009f5d0cecf7d)

commit_message:
[DSH] Delete hardcoded image name

We have a debian 8 image for a long time, which
can be successfully used by docker standalone host
to run dockerized apps, but we still don't use it.
This commit deletes hardcode and adds image field to
ui with filter by type `linux.docker`.

Change-Id: Ie3d9d454cd98f651833b28690d33d55b404dc13d
(cherry picked from commit 906e6586c47d1496d8f6fe6a346009f5d0cecf7d)

commit_message:
Use osc-lib instead of openstackclient

osc-lib is a package of common support modules for writing
OSC plugins.  all common functions, classes such as exceptions,
utils, logs and so on have been moved from openstackclient to
osc-lib.

So use osc-lib instead of openstackclient

Change-Id: Ibc95df888ddfc612da9ad4605b77554d1285964a

commit_message:
Use osc-lib instead of openstackclient

osc-lib is a package of common support modules for writing
OSC plugins. all common functions, classes such as exceptions,
utils, logs and so on have been moved from openstackclient to
osc-lib.

So use osc-lib instead of openstackclient

Change-Id: I04912c9eb0d93ed79b6451e1c70e85f8fc382c1a

commit_message:
Extend YAQL context through Nailgun extensions

It would be very convenient (but not necessary) to extend YAQL context
(i.e. set of helper functions) via Nailgun extensions. That might be
very helpful if end users build their own custom deployments on top of
Fuel.

cherry-picked from 8b4ac0eb65d74ad1a16937852115b58e8f5aab77

Change-Id: Ib47d8204ff995517fc9a4d7889de8bbc9c23f227

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-08-18 08:43:58.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/db/v2/api.py', 'mistral/db/v2/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/db/v2/test_sqlalchemy_db_api.py', 'mistral/db/v2/sqlalchemy/models.py'], 'message': 'Implement named transactional lock (semaphore)

* We need this kind of transactional semaphore implemented in a
  separate table to serialize access to some DB objects based on
  object identifiers (such as name or other string value uniquely
  identifying an object).
  This approach is tested on MySQL and Postgres and according to
  http://blog.udby.com/archives/14 is expected to work on DB2,
  Oracle and possibly other databases.
  The plan is to use named locks to prevent multiple insertions
  of same join tasks.

Change-Id: I9823b986caa8d528ddbad640b437f6199269b637
'}]
commit_message:
Implement named transactional lock (semaphore)

* We need this kind of transactional semaphore implemented in a
  separate table to serialize access to some DB objects based on
  object identifiers (such as name or other string value uniquely
  identifying an object).
  This approach is tested on MySQL and Postgres and according to
  http://blog.udby.com/archives/14 is expected to work on DB2,
  Oracle and possibly other databases.
  The plan is to use named locks to prevent multiple insertions
  of same join tasks.

Change-Id: I9823b986caa8d528ddbad640b437f6199269b637

subject: stop apache2 before configure horizon

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-09-02 03:39:41.000000000', 'files': ['elements/os-svc-install/bin/os-svc-start', 'elements/os-svc-install/bin/os-svc-stop', 'elements/horizon/os-refresh-config/pre-configure.d/97-horizon-apache2', 'elements/os-svc-install/bin/os-svc-control', 'elements/os-svc-install/bin/os-svc-restart'], 'message': "stop apache2 before configure horizon

By default, apache2 is enabled and listening on 0.0.0.0:80. This can
fail haproxy because it will configure apache2 listening on a specific
interface and then listen on other interfaces by itself. Horzion will
enable/restart apache2 in its post-configure stage so it's better to

commit_message:
stop apache2 before configure horizon

By default, apache2 is enabled and listening on 0.0.0.0:80. This can
fail haproxy because it will configure apache2 listening on a specific
interface and then listen on other interfaces by itself. Horzion will
enable/restart apache2 in its post-configure stage so it's better to
stop apache2 in the beginning.

Change-Id: Ie2387701bbe1f7f34cc4166c4945af8eea5bd5e6
Closes-Bug: #1409583

commit_message:
Apache detection

Change method for find process from find_process_cmdline to
find_process_name. If in system is process which name contains
httpd (e.g. static_httpd) but it is not Apache, plugin should not
try to configure detection for it.
Add to detection checking if configuration file exists or
args were given.

Change-Id: I6f54cbea7c4fa2ce587f43d6808e97b3d644ab6e

subject: Enable the swift container-reconciler
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-01-15 14:52:37.000000000', 'files': ['elements/swift-storage/install.d/swift-source-install/76-swift-storage', 'elements/swift-storage/os-apply-config/etc/swift/container-reconciler.conf', 'elements/swift-storage/os-refresh-config/post-configure.d/74-swift-storage'], 'message': 'Enable the swift container-reconciler

The swift storage policy functionality added in juno-1 introduced

The container-reconciler process must run on one (and typically only

commit_message:
Enable the swift container-reconciler

The swift storage policy functionality added in juno-1 introduced
the container-reconciler process.

The container-reconciler process must run on one (and typically only
one) of the swift servers in the cluster. So the post-configure.d
code, in 74-swift-storage, will enable and run the container
reconciler if the run-container-reconciler property is set.

Change-Id: Ic38b23f9ae5a1a0903423b08bfe3b5913cf73170

commit_message:
Add NovaDBPassword to under + overcloud templates

This patch adds the NovaDBPassword parameter to the under and over
cloud templates so that the same mechanism as used in controller.yaml
can be used to set DSN passwords. A default of unset is also added
to the templates, including controller.yaml

commit_message:
ignore whitespace when diffing requirements files

For releases we don't care if there are whitespace changes in the
requirements file, so ignore them to make it easier to identify new or
changed requirements.

Change-Id: Ibb7798c833dfa0f6725a15de99f1f1c2bbd37c02
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: make list-changes smarter about the "previous" version
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-15 20:20:10.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_releases/cmds/list_changes.py', 'openstack_releases/gitutils.py'], 'message': 'make list-changes smarter about the "previous" version

The old implementation of list-changes assumed that the deliverable file
included all releases and that they were in order. That assumption does
not hold for independent projects, where the history might not be there
and new entries might be from different branches than the previous
entries, all in the same file. This change uses git to determine the
previous tag for each repository, then shows the right diffs based on
that instead of the assumed tag from the deliverable file.

Change-Id: I122a6ec1792a07cdb23f09a880110dff2446555e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
make list-changes smarter about the "previous" version

The old implementation of list-changes assumed that the deliverable file
included all releases and that they were in order. That assumption does
not hold for independent projects, where the history might not be there
and new entries might be from different branches than the previous
entries, all in the same file. This change uses git to determine the
previous tag for each repository, then shows the right diffs based on
that instead of the assumed tag from the deliverable file.

Change-Id: I122a6ec1792a07cdb23f09a880110dff2446555e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Fix ironic-conductor task dependencies

The ironic-conductor requires access to the ironic database which is
done in the ironic-db task. Previously we were just waiting for the
database task but we should require the ironic-db task which waits
for the database tasks to be completed and sets up the ironic database
user permissions.

Change-Id: I0a5d9007cf1fc286d4217faf977e54faf010eeb0
Closes-Bug: #1614473

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-16 20:29:47.000000000', 'files': ['files/fuel-ha-utils/ocf/mysql-wss'], 'message': 'Add retry to master gtid query

If all the mysql nodes are booted at the exact same time, we can end up
with a situation where the master determination can occur almost at the
same time. This change updates the gtid fetching that is done during
master determination to include a retry with a random 1-10 second sleep
in an attempt to allow for the other nodes to update pacemaker with
their gtid information.

Change-Id: Ib12fb927391857ca9e3fb0a3ee45a7eec9e7913e
Closes-Bug: #1610180
'}]
commit_message:
Add retry to master gtid query

If all the mysql nodes are booted at the exact same time, we can end up
with a situation where the master determination can occur almost at the
same time. This change updates the gtid fetching that is done during
master determination to include a retry with a random 1-10 second sleep
in an attempt to allow for the other nodes to update pacemaker with
their gtid information.

Change-Id: Ib12fb927391857ca9e3fb0a3ee45a7eec9e7913e
Closes-Bug: #1610180

subject: Authenticate before doing group membership tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-15 13:31:26.000000000', 'files': ['aclmanager.py'], 'message': 'Authenticate before doing group membership tests

Group membership tests (used to determine if a PUT/DELETE call
was superfluous or not) were not using authentication and
therefore always returned 403 (which resulted in PUT requests
to always be needed).

Use authentication in group membership tests, and test for a more
precise return code.

Change-Id: I7784ea7334953c333744c603e0719187cac54951
'}]
commit_message:
Authenticate before doing group membership tests

Group membership tests (used to determine if a PUT/DELETE call
was superfluous or not) were not using authentication and
therefore always returned 403 (which resulted in PUT requests
to always be needed).

Use authentication in group membership tests, and test for a more
precise return code.

Change-Id: I7784ea7334953c333744c603e0719187cac54951

subject: Remove Release Managers from post-release groups
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-15 13:31:26.000000000', 'files': ['README.rst', 'aclmanager.py'], 'message': 'Remove Release Managers from post-release groups

After discussion in a recent release managers meeting, we decided
that Release Managers should be removed from the -release-branch
groups post-release, rather than always be present.

This change adjusts the code to match that policy:
- removes release managers in post-release action
- ensures presence of release managers as part of the pre-release
  action instead of withing a specific ensure_rm action
- add comments to match the policy in the code

Change-Id: I4f900ba66a906031f0a3143aaf25c18700d8012d
'}]
commit_message:
Remove Release Managers from post-release groups

After discussion in a recent release managers meeting, we decided
that Release Managers should be removed from the -release-branch
groups post-release, rather than always be present.

This change adjusts the code to match that policy:
- removes release managers in post-release action
- ensures presence of release managers as part of the pre-release
  action instead of withing a specific ensure_rm action
- add comments to match the policy in the code

Change-Id: I4f900ba66a906031f0a3143aaf25c18700d8012d

subject: fix release notes for final releases
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-08-09 13:23:55.000000000', 'files': ['announce.sh', 'releasetools/cmds/propose_final_releases.py'], 'message': "fix release notes for final releases

We want release announcements for final releases, after release
candidates, to include all of the changes from the release. In a perfect
world, the tag history of the releases would be such that we could ask
git for the previous release. Unfortunately, the tag for the final
release from the previous series is not on the same branch where we are
tagging the final of the new release. It used to be merged in, but at
the wrong point. Now it isn't even being merged in.

Rather than trying to deduce the right start point in the announce
script, this change makes it an optional piece of the tag metadata. When
present, the diff-start value is used. When not present, the old
behavior of using the previous tag is retained.

Given our practice of creating new stable branches on the first release
candidate tag, we can also update propose-final-releases to
automatically set the diff-start value for new final releases to point
to the first release candidate of the last release series. If that
automatic value is wrong, it can be adjusted manually before the final
tags are applied.

See related work in I4dff3a57f4d0c8f625e789ec19683c47983b7877

Depends-On: I4dff3a57f4d0c8f625e789ec19683c47983b7877
Depends-On: If56bf1471659f8a27edbed840a880ac998e6759a
Change-Id: I79c3ff7cc07300af5336a0e9f232f8802d4b4c4a
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
"}]
commit_message:
fix release notes for final releases

We want release announcements for final releases, after release
candidates, to include all of the changes from the release. In a perfect
world, the tag history of the releases would be such that we could ask
git for the previous release. Unfortunately, the tag for the final
release from the previous series is not on the same branch where we are
tagging the final of the new release. It used to be merged in, but at
the wrong point. Now it isn't even being merged in.

Rather than trying to deduce the right start point in the announce
script, this change makes it an optional piece of the tag metadata. When
present, the diff-start value is used. When not present, the old
behavior of using the previous tag is retained.

Given our practice of creating new stable branches on the first release
candidate tag, we can also update propose-final-releases to
automatically set the diff-start value for new final releases to point
to the first release candidate of the last release series. If that
automatic value is wrong, it can be adjusted manually before the final
tags are applied.

See related work in I4dff3a57f4d0c8f625e789ec19683c47983b7877

Depends-On: I4dff3a57f4d0c8f625e789ec19683c47983b7877
Depends-On: If56bf1471659f8a27edbed840a880ac998e6759a
Change-Id: I79c3ff7cc07300af5336a0e9f232f8802d4b4c4a

commit_message:
Batching for tasks in scheduler

Add batch_size config for tasks in scheduler - now
only limited count of tasks can run in one time.

This patch has been added in case of [1]:  polling services
during check_complete.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/mitaka-heat-large-stacks

Change-Id: I235dc83564cce133e1ed629f7d83a880ca2f6ae7

subject: [k8s] Restrict getEndpoints to search only in current pod
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-22 10:53:06.000000000', 'files': ['Docker/Kubernetes/KubernetesPod/package/Classes/KubernetesPod.yaml'], 'message': '[k8s] Restrict getEndpoints to search only in current pod

 * If we have a k8s cluster installed and
   then deploy 2 apps, each on separate pod,
   then in logs we will see 2 endpoints for
   2nd app. Then we will see 3 endpoints for
   next pod/app deployment. The reason is searching
   endpoints was done by whole k8s cluster but it
   should rather be only by current pod.
   Now it is fixed.

Closes-Bug: #1613631

Change-Id: I730016dcd55a922ac6c9ee20f9de500f7831f9c3
'}]
commit_message:
[k8s] Restrict getEndpoints to search only in current pod

 * If we have a k8s cluster installed and
   then deploy 2 apps, each on separate pod,
   then in logs we will see 2 endpoints for
   2nd app. Then we will see 3 endpoints for
   next pod/app deployment. The reason is searching
   endpoints was done by whole k8s cluster but it
   should rather be only by current pod.
   Now it is fixed.

Closes-Bug: #1613631

Change-Id: I730016dcd55a922ac6c9ee20f9de500f7831f9c3

commit_message:
[k8s] Restrict getEndpoints to search only in current pod

 * If we have a k8s cluster installed and
   then deploy 2 apps, each on separate pod,
   then in logs we will see 2 endpoints for
   2nd app. Then we will see 3 endpoints for
   next pod/app deployment. The reason is searching
   endpoints was done by whole k8s cluster but it
   should rather be only by current pod.
   Now it is fixed.

Closes-Bug: #1613631

Change-Id: I730016dcd55a922ac6c9ee20f9de500f7831f9c3

subject: Using assertIsNone() is preferred over assertEqual()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-22 05:49:15.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_tempest_plugin/tests/api/admin/test_nodestates.py'], 'message': 'Using assertIsNone() is preferred over assertEqual()

Following OpenStack Style Guidelines[1].
[H203] Unit test assertions tend to give better messages for more specific assertions.
As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred over assertEqual(None, ...)

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#dictionaries-lists

Change-Id: I46681aad0e7bae5c4b1f62db7987da24f516613d
'}]
commit_message:
Using assertIsNone() is preferred over assertEqual()

Following OpenStack Style Guidelines[1].
[H203] Unit test assertions tend to give better messages for more specific assertions.
As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred over assertEqual(None, ...)

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#dictionaries-lists

Change-Id: I46681aad0e7bae5c4b1f62db7987da24f516613d

commit_message:
Add encryption for DB transportation

Add `bash` provider for resource `exec` in order to handle errors more reliably

Proper ownership attributes are set for octane_data directory

Copy & paste error in seed/upgrade-db.yaml is fixed

Change-Id: I715701a079f06e11480738427305d8b1389f6566

subject: devstack: run zun-compute in docker group
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-08-19 01:53:13.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/lib/zun'], 'message': 'devstack: run zun-compute in docker group

zun-compute requires to access docker daemon, we need to add devstack
user to docker group to let zun-compute have access to docker daemon.

Install docker engine if not installed.

Closes-Bug: #1614392
Closes-Bug: #1614122
Change-Id: I3b78c99c60fdaf21d61a499edb3ccf568cac0247
'}]
commit_message:
devstack: run zun-compute in docker group

zun-compute requires to access docker daemon, we need to add devstack
user to docker group to let zun-compute have access to docker daemon.

Install docker engine if not installed.

Closes-Bug: #1614392
Closes-Bug: #1614122
Change-Id: I3b78c99c60fdaf21d61a499edb3ccf568cac0247

commit_message:
Use more specific asserts in tests

Instead of assertTrue and assertFalse use more specific asserts.
They are compatible with Python 2.7[1] and 3.4[2]

[1]: https://docs.python.org/2.7/library/unittest.html
[2]: https://docs.python.org/3.4/library/unittest.html

Change-Id: Iaf5664d81d8690c6fc56ef07b676803ff21e150f

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-17 19:58:09.000000000', 'files': ['files/fuel-ha-utils/ocf/mysql-wss'], 'message': 'Add retry to master gtid query

If all the mysql nodes are booted at the exact same time, we can end up
with a situation where the master determination can occur almost at the
same time. This change updates the gtid fetching that is done during
master determination to include a retry with a random 1-10 second sleep
in an attempt to allow for the other nodes to update pacemaker with
their gtid information.

Change-Id: Ib12fb927391857ca9e3fb0a3ee45a7eec9e7913e
Closes-Bug: #1610180
'}]
commit_message:
Add retry to master gtid query

If all the mysql nodes are booted at the exact same time, we can end up
with a situation where the master determination can occur almost at the
same time. This change updates the gtid fetching that is done during
master determination to include a retry with a random 1-10 second sleep
in an attempt to allow for the other nodes to update pacemaker with
their gtid information.

Change-Id: Ib12fb927391857ca9e3fb0a3ee45a7eec9e7913e
Closes-Bug: #1610180

subject: [k8s] Restrict getEndpoints to search only in current pod
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-19 12:33:13.000000000', 'files': ['Docker/Kubernetes/KubernetesPod/package/Classes/KubernetesPod.yaml'], 'message': '[k8s] Restrict getEndpoints to search only in current pod

 * If we have a k8s cluster installed and
   then deploy 2 apps, each on separate pod,
   then in logs we will see 2 endpoints for
   2nd app. Then we will see 3 endpoints for
   next pod/app deployment. The reason is searching
   endpoints was done by whole k8s cluster but it
   should rather be only by current pod.
   Now it is fixed.

Closes-Bug: #1613631

Change-Id: I730016dcd55a922ac6c9ee20f9de500f7831f9c3
'}]
commit_message:
[k8s] Restrict getEndpoints to search only in current pod

 * If we have a k8s cluster installed and
   then deploy 2 apps, each on separate pod,
   then in logs we will see 2 endpoints for
   2nd app. Then we will see 3 endpoints for
   next pod/app deployment. The reason is searching
   endpoints was done by whole k8s cluster but it
   should rather be only by current pod.
   Now it is fixed.

Closes-Bug: #1613631

Change-Id: I730016dcd55a922ac6c9ee20f9de500f7831f9c3

subject: Force a restart of all the apache nodes during upgrade
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-18 18:28:37.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/main.yml', 'tasks/keystone_service_setup.yml'], 'message': 'Force a restart of all the apache nodes during upgrade

During the upgrades, the venv path will change and therefore the
apache configuration file will change too.

However we apply the restart of apache after the keystone_service_setup
for nodes [1:] (the first node gets restarted as first task of the
keystone_service_setup).

So during an upgrade, because apache is up, the configuration file has
changed but apache still serves the old code (because not restarted yet
on the nodes 1 and above) when the keystone_service_setup is applied.

The keystone module can then hit any node in the load balancer, which
could be a different version.

This commit fixes the issue by ensuring apache is restarted and
therefore runs the latest code.

Change-Id: Iac94a8fc337c2139d1876b9753e46815910a0ba0
Signed-off-by: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe.evrard@rackspace.co.uk>
(cherry picked from commit 4f30d3a33c18620da30ef29c29a6fe9fe4833543)
'}]
commit_message:
Force a restart of all the apache nodes during upgrade

During the upgrades, the venv path will change and therefore the
apache configuration file will change too.

However we apply the restart of apache after the keystone_service_setup
for nodes [1:] (the first node gets restarted as first task of the
keystone_service_setup).

So during an upgrade, because apache is up, the configuration file has
changed but apache still serves the old code (because not restarted yet
on the nodes 1 and above) when the keystone_service_setup is applied.

The keystone module can then hit any node in the load balancer, which
could be a different version.

This commit fixes the issue by ensuring apache is restarted and
therefore runs the latest code.

Change-Id: Iac94a8fc337c2139d1876b9753e46815910a0ba0
Signed-off-by: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe.evrard@rackspace.co.uk>
(cherry picked from commit 4f30d3a33c18620da30ef29c29a6fe9fe4833543)

commit_message:
Serialize provisioning info within deployment serializer

Because there is no difference between provision graph
and deployment graph from nailgun side,
the graph execution context should contain both
provison info and deployment info. This patch
extends LCM deployment info serializer to include
provison info in serializer output.

Change-Id: I672e8fde1a662bd190dcbda0869c290ff110e2d2
Blueprint: graph-concept-extension

FWaaS v2 Database

interact with this data.

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-07-29 14:59:09.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/test_metadata.py', 'nova/api/metadata/password.py', 'tests-py3.txt', 'nova/availability_zones.py', 'nova/api/metadata/vendordata_json.py', 'nova/api/metadata/base.py', 'nova/api/metadata/handler.py'], 'message': 'Port test_metadata to Python 3

* convert_password(): on Python 3, decode password from UTF-8 if it
  is a byte string
* convert_password(): don't modify password in the loop body, use an
  index increased at each iteration. This is a minor cleanup,
  unrelated to Python 3.
* ec2_md_print() now returns byte strings unchanged. On Python 3,
  str(bytes) uses "b'...'" format which is not the expected result
  (or it raises a BytesWarinng exception when using python3 -bb).
* Replace the base64 module with oslo_serialization.base64 to control
  the output type (bytes or text) on Python 2 and Python 3.
* _make_cache_key(): on Python 3, don't encode the host to UTF-8.
  Python 3 requires text.
* MetadataRequestHandler: on Python 3, encode HTTP body to UTF-8 if
  the body type is Unicode.
* test_metadata:

  - encode hmac.new() parameters using encodeutils.to_utf8()
  - use response.text rather than response.body to compare with
    Unicode string
  - use a byte strings for the instance identifier
  - fix some Unicode versus bytes issues

* tests-py3.txt: run test_metadata on Python 3

This change is partially based on the work of dims,
change Ibb4fa47cd71d697a4996425b1797ac2f8cc363cd.

Co-Authored-By: Davanum Srinivas <davanum@gmail.com>
Partially-Implements: blueprint nova-python3-newton
Change-Id: I4d445a86b13e31a444e99ea07e2f2fbcfa1da0fc
'}]
commit_message:
Port test_metadata to Python 3

* convert_password(): on Python 3, decode password from UTF-8 if it
  is a byte string
* convert_password(): don't modify password in the loop body, use an
  index increased at each iteration. This is a minor cleanup,
  unrelated to Python 3.
* ec2_md_print() now returns byte strings unchanged. On Python 3,
  str(bytes) uses "b'...'" format which is not the expected result
  (or it raises a BytesWarinng exception when using python3 -bb).
* Replace the base64 module with oslo_serialization.base64 to control
  the output type (bytes or text) on Python 2 and Python 3.
* _make_cache_key(): on Python 3, don't encode the host to UTF-8.
  Python 3 requires text.
* MetadataRequestHandler: on Python 3, encode HTTP body to UTF-8 if
  the body type is Unicode.
* test_metadata:

  - encode hmac.new() parameters using encodeutils.to_utf8()
  - use response.text rather than response.body to compare with
    Unicode string
  - use a byte strings for the instance identifier
  - fix some Unicode versus bytes issues

* tests-py3.txt: run test_metadata on Python 3

This change is partially based on the work of dims,
change Ibb4fa47cd71d697a4996425b1797ac2f8cc363cd.

Co-Authored-By: Davanum Srinivas <davanum@gmail.com>
Partially-Implements: blueprint nova-python3-newton
Change-Id: I4d445a86b13e31a444e99ea07e2f2fbcfa1da0fc

commit_message:
Port virt test_hardware to Python 3

* Replace map() with list-comprehension to get a list on Python 3
* Replace zip() with list(zip()) to get a list on Python 3
* Replace a/b with a//b to get a whole number of cores (int) on
  Python 3
* tests-py3.txt: remove virt.test_hardware to run it on Python 3

This change is partially based on the work of dims,
change Ibb4fa47cd71d697a4996425b1797ac2f8cc363cd.

Co-Authored-By: Davanum Srinivas <davanum@gmail.com>
Partially-Implements: blueprint nova-python3-newton
Change-Id: I306200c7fe90abbe0251363dc2fd576e6a7ddcfe

commit_message:
Wait for other (non-HA) services after failover

OSTF retries can't handle neutron agents and after assert_ha_services_ready
call there can be down services.

Change-Id: Idcf2c5d41d2946c94a53cfabe04086f4e3eacf1c

* Replace filter() and map() with a list-comprehension to get a list
  on Python 3

Change-Id: I943b31813e15e9077f230c1746e2975db303961f

commit_message:
Port libvirt test_driver to Python 3

* Use binary files, not text files, in fake_libvirt_utils.file_open()
* Use byte strings for XML
* Set disk size to 0 in mocks to avoid fix TypeError on comparison
  on Python 3
* Replace filter() and map() with a list-comprehension to get a list
  on Python 3
* Replace six.moves.range() with range() in driver.py: there is a
  "from six.moves import range" import at top level
* Replace six.iteritems(dict) with dict.items() to cleanup the code.
* tests-py3.txt: remove libvirt.test_driver to run it on Python 3

This change is partially based on the work of dims,
change Ibb4fa47cd71d697a4996425b1797ac2f8cc363cd.

Co-Authored-By: Davanum Srinivas <davanum@gmail.com>
Partially-Implements: blueprint nova-python3-newton
Change-Id: I943b31813e15e9077f230c1746e2975db303961f

  Unicode string

  between None and int which raises a TypeError on Python 3.

commit_message:
Port test_virt_drivers to Python 3

* test_virt_drivers: pass byte strings to base64.b64encode(), not
  Unicode string
* has_default_ephemeral(): replace "ephemeral_gb <= 0" with
  "ephemeral_gb is None or ephemeral_gb <= 0" to avoid comparison
  between None and int which raises a TypeError on Python 3.
* tests-py3.txt: remove test_virt_drivers to run it on Python 3

This change is partially based on the work of dims,
change Ibb4fa47cd71d697a4996425b1797ac2f8cc363cd.

Co-Authored-By: Davanum Srinivas <davanum@gmail.com>
Partially-Implements: blueprint nova-python3-newton
Change-Id: I490ea0482bae0b234ef9abefbf0db49225cad6ce

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-22 09:26:16.000000000', 'files': ['fuelweb_test/tests/tests_upgrade/test_data_driven_upgrade_ceph_ha.py', 'fuelweb_test/tests/tests_upgrade/test_data_driven_upgrade_net_tmpl.py'], 'message': "Wait for other (non-HA) services after failover

OSTF retries can't handle neutron agents and after assert_ha_services_ready
call there can be down services.

Change-Id: Idcf2c5d41d2946c94a53cfabe04086f4e3eacf1c
"}]
commit_message:
Wait for other (non-HA) services after failover

OSTF retries can't handle neutron agents and after assert_ha_services_ready
call there can be down services.

Change-Id: Idcf2c5d41d2946c94a53cfabe04086f4e3eacf1c

commit_message:
Add bash-completion to packages-list

We need the -sa option, which I don't see as available in Jessie.
git-buildpackage needs a newer version of bash-completion, so
adding it first.

Change-Id: I9844e04650368f4a6a035c08871052ca9bf845c6

subject: add reboot_timeout option to nova_compute
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-11-24 21:59:14.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/compute.pp', 'spec/classes/nova_compute_spec.rb'], 'message': "add reboot_timeout option to nova_compute

reboot_timeout option tells compute to automatically hard reboot an instance
if it has been stuck in a rebooting state longer than N seconds.
Set to 0 to disable. (integer value), defaults to '0'.

Change-Id: Ib59992d720dce32f556cba612e905d0df37a5b60
"}]
commit_message:
add reboot_timeout option to nova_compute

reboot_timeout option tells compute to automatically hard reboot an instance
if it has been stuck in a rebooting state longer than N seconds.
Set to 0 to disable. (integer value), defaults to '0'.

Change-Id: Ib59992d720dce32f556cba612e905d0df37a5b60

Eliminates the ml2_dvr_port_bindings DB table and the duplicated code
that were added to ML2 to support DVR's distributed port bindings by
treating non-distributed port binding as a degenerate case of
distributed port binding.

This WIP patch is a step towards the goal described above. It
introduces a new ml2_port_binding_results DB table with a host field as
part of the primary key, and moves the vif_type and vif_details fields
from the existing ml2_port_bindings and ml2_dvr_port_bindings to this
new table.

An upcoming update to this patch will complete the schema
unification by moving the device_id and status fields from the
ml2_distributed_port_bindings table to the ml2_port_binding_results
table, eliminating the ml2_distributed_port_bindings_table altogether.

passing all unit tests

Change-Id: I2d2111c6ca1c6f2e0b2b2fceabb8318b279911ba
"}]
commit_message:
ML2: Unify schema for binding normal and distributed ports

Eliminates the ml2_dvr_port_bindings DB table and the duplicated code
that were added to ML2 to support DVR's distributed port bindings by
treating non-distributed port binding as a degenerate case of
distributed port binding.

This WIP patch is a step towards the goal described above. It
introduces a new ml2_port_binding_results DB table with a host field as
part of the primary key, and moves the vif_type and vif_details fields
from the existing ml2_port_bindings and ml2_dvr_port_bindings to this
new table.

An upcoming update to this patch will complete the schema
unification by moving the device_id and status fields from the
ml2_distributed_port_bindings table to the ml2_port_binding_results
table, eliminating the ml2_distributed_port_bindings_table altogether.
More logic cleanup will be possible once the DB schema is unified.
passing all unit tests

Co-Authored-By: Robert Kukura <kukura@noironetworks.com>

Closes-bug: 1367391
Change-Id: I2d2111c6ca1c6f2e0b2b2fceabb8318b279911ba

commit_message:
[WIP] Adding Port Statistics to Neutron Metering Agent

Currently the Neutron Metering Agent only measures the bandwidth usage of the
Routers. The Neutron Metering Agent is extended to also support Port statistics
using the OpenvSwitch tools.

Change-Id: I545fcae249a8a08923913648b7839be4e2dff014
Closes-Bug: #1592918

subject: Change assertTrue(isinstance()) by optimal assert
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-19 01:57:29.000000000', 'files': ['pbr/tests/test_setup.py'], 'message': 'Change assertTrue(isinstance()) by optimal assert

Some of tests use different method of assertTrue(isinstance(A, B))
or assertEqual(type(A), B).
The correct way is to use assertIsInstance(A, B) provided by testtools.

Change-Id: I6c7aa04a3a3aaaab7f428cb86549a4d043af802f
'}]
commit_message:
Change assertTrue(isinstance()) by optimal assert

Some of tests use different method of assertTrue(isinstance(A, B))
or assertEqual(type(A), B).
The correct way is to use assertIsInstance(A, B) provided by testtools.

Change-Id: I6c7aa04a3a3aaaab7f428cb86549a4d043af802f

commit_message:
Fixes to get cluster data model

Due to the recent code refactor in the cluster data model

attribute

existed, openstack client will return error message `ERROR: None`.
Message need to be able to indicate which template not found (or at least

commit_message:
Add error message for template not found in osc

With command `openstack stack create -t rico.yaml` plus rico.yaml never
existed, openstack client will return error message `ERROR: None`.
Message need to be able to indicate which template not found (or at least
indicate what's going on)
Closes-Bug: #1615062

Change-Id: I19b6825132d8e9c792770a607bb73850d3630478

commit_message:
designate: Add a non-voting job with postgres as DB backend

Currently designate is not tested with PosgreSQL. Add a non-voting job
to be able to catch the current errors and fix them.
Also remove the not used legacy job called
"gate-designate-dsvm-{designate-driver}-postgres".

Change-Id: I2aab56c1ac817e68d42fa7a444df8243b0ad6e3c

commit_message:
Remove deprecated manager option in cells.py

The manager option in cells group is deprecated in mitaka
and hence removed in newton.

Checked cells.py for check_deprecation_status and
removed the tag according to wiki.
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ConfigOptionsConsistency

Blueprint centralize-config-options-newton

Change-Id: Iebd6c261d7e5ca531dbf473f1d986b2e42f02e41

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-19 20:51:35.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Make gate-tempest-dsvm-multinode-live-migration gating for nova

Since we started skipping the non-shared storage volume-backed
live migration tests that were causing the majority of the spurious
failures:

2f68cd3e9f47ca5bb864c26c1b0b123918197ef4

The gate-tempest-dsvm-multinode-live-migration job has gotten
substantially more stable so that's it's comparable to the
gate-tempest-dsvm-full-ubuntu-xenial job:

http://goo.gl/NLRvl7

The job takes only around 30 minutes to run and is controlled
via the nova repo itself so can be disabled/fixed in tree if
necessary.

We should make this voting to avoid any regressions in live migration
as we wind down toward the newton-3 milestone.

Change-Id: Ifa2823305a72352667b65a41d0e6c6a53db9553b
"}]
commit_message:
Make gate-tempest-dsvm-multinode-live-migration gating for nova

Since we started skipping the non-shared storage volume-backed
live migration tests that were causing the majority of the spurious
failures:

2f68cd3e9f47ca5bb864c26c1b0b123918197ef4

The gate-tempest-dsvm-multinode-live-migration job has gotten
substantially more stable so that's it's comparable to the
gate-tempest-dsvm-full-ubuntu-xenial job:

http://goo.gl/NLRvl7

The job takes only around 30 minutes to run and is controlled
via the nova repo itself so can be disabled/fixed in tree if
necessary.

We should make this voting to avoid any regressions in live migration
as we wind down toward the newton-3 milestone.

Change-Id: Ifa2823305a72352667b65a41d0e6c6a53db9553b

subject: Enable QoS on neutron for python-openstacksdk.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-18 13:49:01.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/sdk.yaml'], 'message': 'Enable QoS on neutron for python-openstacksdk.

Testing the sdk & client integration to neutron we need to enable
the qos service and extension.

This patch enables this by importing the on-tree neutron plugin
and enabling the q-qos service.

Change-Id: Idf319cd182304952071bc976a2e56c42fbcb8468
Related-bug: 1609037
'}]
commit_message:
Enable QoS on neutron for python-openstacksdk.

Testing the sdk & client integration to neutron we need to enable
the qos service and extension.

This patch enables this by importing the on-tree neutron plugin
and enabling the q-qos service.

Change-Id: Idf319cd182304952071bc976a2e56c42fbcb8468
Related-bug: 1609037

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-21 18:23:52.000000000', 'files': ['gerrit/acls/openstack/glare.config', 'accessbot/channels.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'gerrit/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Glare

Glare (from GLare Artifact REpository) is a service that
provides access to a unified catalog of structured
meta-information as well as related binary data
(these structures are also called 'artifacts').

Glare offers its users a number of important features, like:
 * Custom assets — it's not just images anymore, but also Heat
   templates, Murano packages, Mistral workbooks, Tacker
   blueprints and so on.
 * Artifacts versioning — each artifact can be supplemented
   with the version in SemVer format.
 * Support of multiple binary objects per artifact. From
   Glare’s part, it allows to specify a set of such attributes.
 * Structured properties — artifacts may contain structured
   properties like ‘dict’ and ‘list’.
 * Dependencies between artifacts — one artifact may depend on
   the other.
 * Additional filtering for artifacts with various operators.
 * Importing/exporting of artifacts between clouds.

Change-Id: Ibf0896894d53c04d7391f845303997090eac09ab
"}]
commit_message:
Glare

Glare (from GLare Artifact REpository) is a service that
provides access to a unified catalog of structured
meta-information as well as related binary data
(these structures are also called 'artifacts').

Glare offers its users a number of important features, like:
 * Custom assets — it's not just images anymore, but also Heat
   templates, Murano packages, Mistral workbooks, Tacker
   blueprints and so on.
 * Artifacts versioning — each artifact can be supplemented
   with the version in SemVer format.
 * Support of multiple binary objects per artifact. From
   Glare’s part, it allows to specify a set of such attributes.
 * Structured properties — artifacts may contain structured
   properties like ‘dict’ and ‘list’.
 * Dependencies between artifacts — one artifact may depend on
   the other.
 * Additional filtering for artifacts with various operators.
 * Importing/exporting of artifacts between clouds.

Change-Id: Ibf0896894d53c04d7391f845303997090eac09ab

commit_message:
api-ref - build/resource-type/versions

This patch fixes the format and content of the api-ref documentation for
the build-info, resource-type-{list|template|schema}, versions APIs.
Major changes include:
- use status code table to show response codes
- add missing response parameters such as request id
- fixed cases where the response format was not clearly/correctly
  documented.

Change-Id: Id7ac58ff19d3f7a0feb4d872efa7b46c01fa8f4b

commit_message:
Don't manipulate config for admin creds

Soon this will be global tempest config, so modifying it is not an
option.

Instead the client manager can now be replaced with one which uses admin
credentials when setup_clients_for_admin is called.

blueprint tempest-plugin-support

Change-Id: I9c1b80ec2048d227cc99c06808da90745fcf516e

subject: Register heat tempest plugin
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-08-12 22:05:06.000000000', 'files': ['heat_integrationtests/common/config.py', 'setup.cfg', 'heat_integrationtests/plugin.py'], 'message': 'Register heat tempest plugin

This allows heat_integrationtests tests to be run with the current
method *or* with the tempest runner. To run with tempest, configure
heat_integrationtests/heat_integrationtests.conf as before, then add
the following to the configured tempest.conf:

  [service_available]
  heat_plugin = True

Then run with tempest, for example

  tempest run --regex heat_integrationtests

The next step will be for tempest runs to take configuration values
from tempest.conf rather than heat_integrationtests.conf

blueprint tempest-plugin-support

Change-Id: I920a6616dbd79092d5bf9a8c4f48da2f94c0a326
'}]
commit_message:
Register heat tempest plugin

This allows heat_integrationtests tests to be run with the current
method *or* with the tempest runner. To run with tempest, configure
heat_integrationtests/heat_integrationtests.conf as before, then add
the following to the configured tempest.conf:

  [service_available]
  heat_plugin = True

Then run with tempest, for example

  tempest run --regex heat_integrationtests

The next step will be for tempest runs to take configuration values
from tempest.conf rather than heat_integrationtests.conf

blueprint tempest-plugin-support

Change-Id: I920a6616dbd79092d5bf9a8c4f48da2f94c0a326

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-08-12 22:05:06.000000000', 'files': ['heat_integrationtests/requirements.stub', 'test-requirements.txt', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Depend on tempest in test-requirements.txt

This replaces the requirements.stub dependency approach for
heat_integrationtests with a single dependency on tempest in
test-requirements.txt.

tempest provides all the required dependencies for the current
heat_integrationtests, and this helps the transition of being able to
run tests both with the current runner and as a tempest plugin.

blueprint tempest-plugin-support

Change-Id: I6fc5886feec5de71826f640cd29990114bd7781c
'}]
commit_message:
Depend on tempest in test-requirements.txt

This replaces the requirements.stub dependency approach for
heat_integrationtests with a single dependency on tempest in
test-requirements.txt.

tempest provides all the required dependencies for the current
heat_integrationtests, and this helps the transition of being able to
run tests both with the current runner and as a tempest plugin.

blueprint tempest-plugin-support

Change-Id: I6fc5886feec5de71826f640cd29990114bd7781c

commit_message:
Support DPDK

Implement portbinding function for vhost user space.
In order to take advantage of user space datapath powered
by DPDK, you should change 'ENABLE_DPDK' to True in your
devstack local.conf.

Change-Id: Id1bc912822f7dde15883ea9f2a867c214d0a6a1f
Implements: blueprint dpdk-support

commit_message:
Updated flags for XVP config options

XVP options are compatible with consistency guide [0], updated header
flags accordingly.

Because there was a discussion without clear outcome whether XVP shoud be
dropped, so I am leaving check_deprecated_status flag for a time being, until
it clears out.

[0] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ConfigOptionsConsistency
[1] http://www.gossamer-threads.com/lists/openstack/operators/50794

subject: Add project group to role
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-20 19:59:21.000000000', 'files': ['defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Add project group to role

This patch adds a var used by the repo_build process to determine
which host group to check for members of before building the pip
packages required by this role. This provides the ability to
optimise the repo build process to only building the packages
that are required for an environment.

Depends-On: Idda16b4f382eee57c7469af898859d6d81d4eb30
Change-Id: Iedb4c0c91daa291f881a9fc00c5b8c40bb312ce3
'}]
commit_message:
Add project group to role

This patch adds a var used by the repo_build process to determine
which host group to check for members of before building the pip
packages required by this role. This provides the ability to
optimise the repo build process to only building the packages
that are required for an environment.

Depends-On: Idda16b4f382eee57c7469af898859d6d81d4eb30
Change-Id: Iedb4c0c91daa291f881a9fc00c5b8c40bb312ce3

commit_message:
Use classname as prefix of volume name

Sometimes volume may not be cleaned properly and from its name
(such as tempest-Volume-245831117) it is difficult to know which
testcase created it. This is to use classname as prefix of volume
name.

Change-Id: Ic0e376098caa0c46473d92f6d043ab85fbbaee8c

commit_message:
Fix deprecated auth options in quickstart

As noted in the bug below, the quickstart guide
references the deprecated OS_TENANT_NAME option.

This patch replaces it with
OS_PROJECT_ID and explains how to get said id.

subject: Tweak endpoint discovery for apache-style services
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-12 03:22:57.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/session.py', 'openstack/tests/unit/test_session.py'], 'message': 'Tweak endpoint discovery for apache-style services

When a service is supposed to run in Apache, the endpoint registered
contains no port number, so the path part in its endpoint URI becomes
the "identity" of a service. We should preserve the path part when
determining the "root endpoint" in those cases.

Change-Id: I38010d2a122fdb2cf070fc06d422e200a9abb39c
'}]
commit_message:
Tweak endpoint discovery for apache-style services

When a service is supposed to run in Apache, the endpoint registered
contains no port number, so the path part in its endpoint URI becomes
the "identity" of a service. We should preserve the path part when
determining the "root endpoint" in those cases.

Change-Id: I38010d2a122fdb2cf070fc06d422e200a9abb39c

subject: Add create and update methods to credential Manager
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-08-18 17:29:59.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/credential/core.py'], 'message': "Add create and update methods to credential Manager

Previously, the credential controller would just call
``self.credential_api.<crud_method>`` which would just automatically call
the driver since the credential manager didn't implement any sort of business
logic around credentials.

With the implementation of encrypted credentials at rest, it makes sense to
have the encryption logic in the credential manager, instead of the driver or
controller layer. This commit creates those methods in the manager which will
be more useful for credential encryption in a subsequent commit.

bp credential-encryption

Change-Id: I22ec70aeaf12b5df9ed7d27985fc284c5c31533e
"}]
commit_message:
Add create and update methods to credential Manager

Previously, the credential controller would just call
``self.credential_api.<crud_method>`` which would just automatically call
the driver since the credential manager didn't implement any sort of business
logic around credentials.

With the implementation of encrypted credentials at rest, it makes sense to
have the encryption logic in the credential manager, instead of the driver or
controller layer. This commit creates those methods in the manager which will
be more useful for credential encryption in a subsequent commit.

bp credential-encryption

Change-Id: I22ec70aeaf12b5df9ed7d27985fc284c5c31533e

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-08-08 11:23:07.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/appdev-guide/murano_pl/metadata.rst'], 'message': '[docs] Remove "meta-class" term

Term "meta-class" could be understood in a wrong way due to different
meanings in Python and MuranoPL. So it is better to change it to
"metadata class", just "metadata" or just "class" where appropriate
across the documentation.

Change-Id: I6bec63f9268cb96c721ef419c5b53a80359eb9f8
'}]
commit_message:
[docs] Remove "meta-class" term

Term "meta-class" could be understood in a wrong way due to different
meanings in Python and MuranoPL. So it is better to change it to
"metadata class", just "metadata" or just "class" where appropriate
across the documentation.

Change-Id: I6bec63f9268cb96c721ef419c5b53a80359eb9f8

commit_message:
[Docs] Moves network configuration to admin-guide

Changes:

- Restructures and moves Network configuration to the appropriate
  section of the Admin Guide.
- Removes Murano Installation Guide from the Miscellaneous section as
  it has already been rewritten and moved to the Admin Guide
  (see sections: Deploying Murano and Prepare a lab for Murano)
- No changes in the Policy configuration section.

Change-Id: I7d396375a312648ad2f05350b87079601b7c0878
Partial-Bug: #1603950

subject: Deleteing an instance shouldn't need to stop the datastore first
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-18 06:00:24.000000000', 'files': ['trove/instance/models.py'], 'message': 'Deleteing an instance shouldn't need to stop the datastore first

When we are deleting a datastore i'm not sure there is a compelling
reason to stop the datastore before starting to delete the resources.
Many times on an ERROR instance this has to wait until the call times
out before then going and deleting the instance resources.

I add the ERROR this state to join to self.db_info.server_status,
in order to solve the above said "Many times on an ERROR instance
this has to wait until the call timesout before then going and
deleting the instance resources."

Please help me to look at this change for yao...

Change-Id: I104a7c9ecdc2b5b70af5ac6741f5c4eba722abf6
Closes-Bug: #1525428
'}]
commit_message:
Deleteing an instance shouldn't need to stop the datastore first

When we are deleting a datastore i'm not sure there is a compelling
reason to stop the datastore before starting to delete the resources.
Many times on an ERROR instance this has to wait until the call times
out before then going and deleting the instance resources.

I add the ERROR this state to join to self.db_info.server_status,
in order to solve the above said "Many times on an ERROR instance
this has to wait until the call timesout before then going and
deleting the instance resources."

Please help me to look at this change for yao...

Change-Id: I104a7c9ecdc2b5b70af5ac6741f5c4eba722abf6
Closes-Bug: #1525428

subject: Get the status of the ip with ip.get('status')
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-08-21 23:22:00.000000000', 'files': ['shade/tests/unit/test_floating_ip_neutron.py', 'shade/_utils.py'], 'message': "Get the status of the ip with ip.get('status')

Ensure that there is no error if the key doesn't exist in the ip.

The API spec indicates this field should be a string and should always
exist. However, it has been reported in the wild that sometimes it's
missing. Yay for specs. If there is no status, set it to 'UNKNOWN' so
that there is at least some indication in logging for a user as to what's
going on.

Change-Id: I27a8bd35e6614ac24b8cbb1ada8c101329fd2f7f
"}]
commit_message:
Get the status of the ip with ip.get('status')

Ensure that there is no error if the key doesn't exist in the ip.

The API spec indicates this field should be a string and should always
exist. However, it has been reported in the wild that sometimes it's
missing. Yay for specs. If there is no status, set it to 'UNKNOWN' so
that there is at least some indication in logging for a user as to what's
going on.

Change-Id: I27a8bd35e6614ac24b8cbb1ada8c101329fd2f7f

commit_message:
Load wsgi apps with paste.deploy

This change replaces the hard coded WSGI app creation with a
pipeline of WSGI apps declared in a configuration file.

Change-Id: I1969e3eec7be1c28b637451c71cfe450c91b959f
Partially-Implements: blueprint support-multi-tenancy

commit_message:
Fix a minor error in API reference

Based on test result, response body of claim messages API
includes a top level key "messages" whose vlaue is a list of
messages being successfully claimed. This patch revises
corresponding sample in API reference.

commit_message:
[functional] Skip tests if API doesn't support microversion

To allow launching functional tests of latest novaclient with previous
OpenStack releases, we should skip those tests which check unsupported
microversions.

commit_message:
Change deprecated assertEquals to assertEqual

It literally doesn't matter, but also getting deprecation warnings is
equally silly. Change the deprecated things to the non-deprecated one,
and then enable the check that prevents this from happening in the first
place.

Change-Id: Icd714da7ee881fad0c201e9cd56b32a4a330a431

subject: Stop getting extra flavor specs where they're useless
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-08-21 20:51:24.000000000', 'files': ['shade/operatorcloud.py', 'shade/openstackcloud.py'], 'message': "Stop getting extra flavor specs where they're useless

We supplement flavors with the values in extra_specs as a default.
However, there are several places where we're getting flavor objects on
behalf of the user where we know that we will not use them. Make sure
that we can plumb through the get_extra flag, and then pass it as False
in the places where getting the extra specs is just a waste of time.

Change-Id: I46d8ed5537a94a0440dd42d305221686cf1b225b
"}]
commit_message:
Stop getting extra flavor specs where they're useless

We supplement flavors with the values in extra_specs as a default.
However, there are several places where we're getting flavor objects on
behalf of the user where we know that we will not use them. Make sure
that we can plumb through the get_extra flag, and then pass it as False
in the places where getting the extra specs is just a waste of time.

Change-Id: I46d8ed5537a94a0440dd42d305221686cf1b225b

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-16 07:53:26.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/linux/ip_lib.py'], 'message': "ip_lib: Use execute() from neutron.common.utils

Due to tempest bug 1592345 we're not able to import
neutron.common.config module in in-tree tempest tests due to its
side-effect. An implication from it is that we also can't import
ip_lib because of indirect import of the config module. This
patch avoids importing config module by using execute() from
its original location. Previous
neutron.agent.common.utils.execute() is taken from
neutron.common.utils so it's safe to use the original function instead.

Change-Id: Iefb776b044b75b07f77a6d9f30ff07ec8309aabc
Related-bug: 1592345
"}]
commit_message:
ip_lib: Use execute() from neutron.common.utils

Due to tempest bug 1592345 we're not able to import
neutron.common.config module in in-tree tempest tests due to its
side-effect. An implication from it is that we also can't import
ip_lib because of indirect import of the config module. This
patch avoids importing config module by using execute() from
its original location. Previous
neutron.agent.common.utils.execute() is taken from
neutron.common.utils so it's safe to use the original function instead.

Change-Id: Iefb776b044b75b07f77a6d9f30ff07ec8309aabc
Related-bug: 1592345

subject: Fixed net_id key evaluation for net['id']
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-15 13:37:46.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/scenario/manager.py'], 'message': "Fixed net_id key evaluation for net['id']

commit 136376f3e8b545153ac5ff6e6f918f7ef7d3d28a added the following line
net_id = net.get('uuid', net['id'])
even if net['uuid'] is present net['id'] is still evaluated and fails
since does not exist.

Change-Id: Iafa054ce300ea84a3f2439e5504d4aa768e4c4b0
"}]
commit_message:
Fixed net_id key evaluation for net['id']

commit 136376f3e8b545153ac5ff6e6f918f7ef7d3d28a added the following line
net_id = net.get('uuid', net['id'])
even if net['uuid'] is present net['id'] is still evaluated and fails
since does not exist.

Change-Id: Iafa054ce300ea84a3f2439e5504d4aa768e4c4b0

commit_message:
Allow automatic toc to be disabled

In some cases, a user may want to disable the automatic table of
contents generation in the body of the page. This patch adds
a ``display_toc`` option into the theme options list that will
disable the automatic TOC in the documentation body.

Closes-Bug: 1613761

Change-Id: I508b46c5ba6a022ee4ad2687cb4e44ed449ca4fe

Volume IDs and the other parameters are passed as string and Tempest

"}]
commit_message:
Remove unnecessary str() from base_types_client

Volume IDs and the other parameters are passed as string and Tempest
doesn't need str() calls for them.
This patch removes these str() for the code cleanup.

Change-Id: Ic5e6e9d52aca78f1171ef1ee827f6c4cef848c67

commit_message:
Log node uuid rather than id when acquiring node lock

When attempting to get lock of a node, we get such log:
    "Attempting to get exclusive lock on node 2 (for
     port update)"
However, when reserving and releasing the same node lock,
we get such log:
    "Node 7c3c747d-6315-4db8-8fa5-8e55cf2bcc34 successfully
     reserved for port update (took 0.02 seconds)"
    "Successfully released exclusive lock for port update
     on node 7c3c747d-6315-4db8-8fa5-8e55cf2bcc34 (lock
     was held 0.04 sec)"

Sometimes, we log node_id but in other places, we log
node_uuid. It will become a challenge for trouble shooting
with such inconsistent log.

With this change we always log node_uuid when acquiring node
lock.

Change-Id: Icac16d490d654c73cc99e5d2a9a7c682adbc2802
Closes-bug: #1602490

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-11 17:22:25.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/utils.py'], 'message': "Refactor cinder.utils._copy_volume_with_path

Our current _copy_volume_with_path method builds the command it wants to
execute in a non ordered way, meaning that it first builds the end of
the command to execute, then the middle, then the second part, and then
the first part, which makes it hard to follow.

It's not only hard to follow but inefficient, since we keep creating
unnecessary lists.

This patch does a little refactor of the method so that it is built from
the start of the command (with the prefix) to the end.

Change-Id: I88f941d6f9b3be59b849e4d894eeb06dbbd0d103
"}]
commit_message:
Refactor cinder.utils._copy_volume_with_path

Our current _copy_volume_with_path method builds the command it wants to
execute in a non ordered way, meaning that it first builds the end of
the command to execute, then the middle, then the second part, and then
the first part, which makes it hard to follow.

It's not only hard to follow but inefficient, since we keep creating
unnecessary lists.

This patch does a little refactor of the method so that it is built from
the start of the command (with the prefix) to the end.

Change-Id: I88f941d6f9b3be59b849e4d894eeb06dbbd0d103

The image proxy API GET/DELETE methods are deprecated
at microversion 2.36 and will return a 404 after that.

This adds the wraps decorator to those python API methods
so set the cap at 2.35 so rather than get a 404 you'll
get a more uesful VersionNotFoundForAPIMethod.

Note that set_meta and delete_meta are not decorated
because we missed deprecating the image-metadata proxy API
with the 2.36 microversion. That will be fixed in Ocata.

Change-Id: Ie65efadb5c65e8a624ffd0315a634accd49f1c30
"}]
commit_message:
Cap image API deprecated methods at 2.35

The image proxy API GET/DELETE methods are deprecated
at microversion 2.36 and will return a 404 after that.

This adds the wraps decorator to those python API methods
so set the cap at 2.35 so rather than get a 404 you'll
get a more uesful VersionNotFoundForAPIMethod.

Note that set_meta and delete_meta are not decorated
because we missed deprecating the image-metadata proxy API
with the 2.36 microversion. That will be fixed in Ocata.

Related to blueprint deprecate-api-proxies

Change-Id: Ie65efadb5c65e8a624ffd0315a634accd49f1c30

Change-Id: Icc9fc7ce2e2115ce101d95c37024223d1d650fa2
'}]
commit_message:
Cap baremetal python APIs at 2.35

The 2.36 microversion makes the baremetal APIs return a 404
so rather than get that back, this change wraps the baremetal
python API methods so they are capped at 2.35. Using them
after that version will raise VersionNotFoundForAPIMethod.

Related to blueprint deprecate-api-proxies

Change-Id: Icc9fc7ce2e2115ce101d95c37024223d1d650fa2

commit_message:
Use cloud fixtures from the unittest base class

We need to do things to protect against local environment leaking into
the test fixtures when we create the cloud objects. Those things are all
done in the base unittest TestCase class, but for reasons that are hard
to fathom, we ignore that and create our own clouds in many of the
unitttest classes. This leads to problems if a user running the
unittests has cache config information in their local clouds.yaml.

Fix it.

Change-Id: I022d541d8e98bf4b6691bf0a91e3b7d20b2b7456
